description: The HR dataset is a comprehensive collection of employee-related data gathered over time to help the HR team make informed decisions about workforce management, recruitment, retention, and performance improvement. This dataset captures various aspects of an employeeâ€™s lifecycle within the organization, from hiring to exit, and includes key metrics and performance indicators.
goal: Reduce Employee Turnover and Improve Retention Strategies.

indicator_list.name: missing_inconsistent_data
indicator_list.description: Any missing values in critical fields like assigned_group, assignee, resolved_date, or requester should be flagged.
indicator_list.threshold: Rows with over 5% missing critical fields should be excluded or revisited.

indicator_list.name: sla_breach_analysis
indicator_list.description: Identify instances where SLA (Service Level Agreement) breaches occur, particularly in high-priority tickets.
indicator_list.threshold: More than 10% of high-priority tickets should be reviewed for SLA compliance.

indicator_list.name: status_discrepancies
indicator_list.description: Check for inconsistencies in the status field, such as tickets marked as 'resolved' but still have open issues.
indicator_list.threshold: Any tickets with status 'resolved' but unresolved dates should be flagged for review.

indicator_list.name: time_to_resolution_outliers
indicator_list.description: Analyze the time_to_resolution for outliers that significantly exceed the average resolution time.
indicator_list.threshold: Tickets with time_to_resolution greater than 2 standard deviations from the mean should be investigated.

indicator_list.name: priority_distribution
indicator_list.description: Examine the distribution of request types across different priority levels to ensure balanced handling.
indicator_list.threshold: Any priority level with less than 5% of total tickets should be flagged for potential review.

indicator_list.name: category_subcategory_mismatch
indicator_list.description: Identify tickets where the category does not align with the subcategory assigned.
indicator_list.threshold: Any tickets with mismatched category and subcategory should be reviewed for accuracy.

indicator_list.name: assignee workload imbalance
indicator_list.description: Monitor the distribution of tickets among assignees to identify potential workload imbalances.
indicator_list.threshold: Any assignee with more than 20% of total tickets should be flagged for workload review.

indicator_list.name: impact assessment
indicator_list.description: Evaluate the impact ratings assigned to tickets to ensure they are consistent with the request type and priority.
indicator_list.threshold: Any tickets with high impact but low priority should be reviewed for potential misclassification.

indicator_list.name: resolution_description completeness
indicator_list.description: Check for completeness and clarity in the resolution_description field to ensure proper documentation.
indicator_list.threshold: Any tickets with resolution descriptions shorter than 10 words should be flagged for review.

indicator_list.name: requester engagement
indicator_list.description: Analyze the frequency of requests from each requester to identify potential patterns or engagement issues.
indicator_list.threshold: Requesters with more than 5 open tickets should be flagged for follow-up.
